answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!I’ll come straight to the point. Generally such wounds that do not heal are called no-healing ulcers in medical term. They could be due to underlying infection, low supply of oxygen to the wound that is reducing the healing process, underlying diabetes, or due to underlying dermatitis. You need a culture sensitivity of wound scraping to know what antibiotics will suit the infection. If there is underlying dermatitis, then this needs to be taken care of. Wound debridement would be required along with plastic repair. If there is severe atherosclerosis preventing blood supply to wound, then this needs to be diagnosed by angiograms. Also too tight skin being stitched up can break open the wound when there is pressure on the wound.It would be a good idea to consult the surgeon regarding plastic repair by skin graft, after taking care of underlying cause.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
